intro: Thoracostachyum hypolytroides var. immensum, commonly known as the giant sotol, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Agavaceae family, characterized by its rosette-forming structure and succulent leaves. The plant features long, narrow, blue-gray leaves that are often lined with white or yellowish markings. It produces a tall flowering stalk that bears small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a panicle inflorescence. This species is adapted to hot, dry climates and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy plant in xeriscaped environments.
